main event: Multiple pilots reported sightings of an unidentified object resembling a tow target over Misawa AFB in Japan on 23 August 1949.
interesting points: Observers reported that the object was not identifiable as a Japanese kite due to its speed and shape, and pilots in the area reported no sightings.
Radar sites in the area were inoperative due to routine shutdown, and no anti-aircraft units were firing at the time of the sighting.
The object was described as yellow or silver, with no apparent propulsion, support, or lights, and was estimated to be at a speed of 300 to 500 MPH.
The sighting was made by qualified P-80 pilots, and the observers were deemed to be intelligent and capable of making accurate and reliable observations.
The object disappeared from view behind a parked aircraft and was not observed again, possibly due to heat waves caused by another aircraft warming up on the ramp.
sighted object: unidentified object resembling a tow target
witnesses: qualified P-80 pilots from the 339th Fighter Interceptor Squadron
